body: ![GitHub Workflow Status](https://img.shields.io/github/actions/workflow/status/mosquito-cr/mosquito/ci.yml?branch=master&style=for-the-badge) [![GitHub](https://img.shields.io/github/license/mosquito-cr/mosquito.svg?style=for-the-badge)](https://tldrlegal.com/license/mit-license) Mosquito is a generic background job runner written primarily for Crystal. Significant inspiration from experience with the successes and failings many Ruby gems in this vein. Mosquito currently provides these features: - Delayed execution - Scheduled / Periodic execution - Job Storage in Redis - Automatic rescheduling of failed jobs - Progressively increasing delay of failed jobs - Dead letter queue of jobs which have failed too many times - Rate limited jobs Current Limitations: - Visibility into a running job network and queue is limited. There is a working proof of concept [visualization API](https://github.com/mosquito-cr/mosquito/issues/90) and [bare-bones terminal application](https://github.com/mosquito-cr/tui-visualizer). ## Project State The Mosquito project is stable. A few folks are using Mosquito in production, and it's going okay. There are some features which would be nice to have, but what is here is both tried and tested. If you're using Mosquito, please [get in touch](https://github.com/mosquito-cr/mosquito/discussions) on the Discussion board or [on Crystal chat](https://crystal-lang.org/community/) with any questions, feature suggestions, or feedback. ## Installation Update your `shard.yml` to include mosquito: ```diff dependencies: + mosquito: + github: mosquito-cr/mosquito ``` ## Usage ### Step 1: Define a queued job ```crystal # src/jobs/puts_job.cr class PutsJob < Mosquito::QueuedJob param message : String def perform puts message end end ``` ### Step 2: Trigger that job ```crystal # src//.cr PutsJob.new(message: "ohai background job").enqueue ``` ### Step 3: Run your worker to process the job ```crystal # src/worker.cr Mosquito.configure do |settings| settings.redis_url = ENV["REDIS_URL"] end Mosquito::Runner.start ``` ```text crystal run src/worker.cr ``` ### Success ``` > crystal run src/worker.cr 2017-11-06 17:07:29 - Mosquito is buzzing... 2017-11-06 17:07:51 - Running task puts_job<...> from puts_job 2017-11-06 17:07:51 - [PutsJob] ohai background job 2017-11-06 17:07:51 - task puts_job<...> succeeded, took 0.0 seconds ``` [More information about queued jobs](https://mosquito-cr.github.io/manual/index.html#queued-jobs) in the manual. ------ ## Periodic Jobs Periodic jobs run according to a predefined period -- once an hour, etc. This periodic job: ```crystal class PeriodicallyPutsJob < Mosquito::PeriodicJob run_every 1.minute def perform emotions = %w{happy sad angry optimistic political skeptical epuhoric} puts "The time is now #{Time.local} and the wizard is feeling #{emotions.sample}" end end ``` Would produce this output: ```crystal 2017-11-06 17:20:13 - Mosquito is buzzing... 2017-11-06 17:20:13 - Queues: periodically_puts_job 2017-11-06 17:20:13 - Running task periodically_puts_job<...> from periodically_puts_job 2017-11-06 17:20:13 - [PeriodicallyPutsJob] The time is now 2017-11-06 17:20:13 and the wizard is feeling skeptical 2017-11-06 17:20:13 - task periodically_puts_job<...> succeeded, took 0.0 seconds 2017-11-06 17:21:14 - Queues: periodically_puts_job 2017-11-06 17:21:14 - Running task periodically_puts_job<...> from periodically_puts_job 2017-11-06 17:21:14 - [PeriodicallyPutsJob] The time is now 2017-11-06 17:21:14 and the wizard is feeling optimistic 2017-11-06 17:21:14 - task periodically_puts_job<...> succeeded, took 0.0 seconds 2017-11-06 17:22:15 - Queues: periodically_puts_job 2017-11-06 17:22:15 - Running task periodically_puts_job<...> from periodically_puts_job 2017-11-06 17:22:15 - [PeriodicallyPutsJob] The time is now 2017-11-06 17:22:15 and the wizard is feeling political 2017-11-06 17:22:15 - task periodically_puts_job<...> succeeded, took 0.0 seconds ``` [More information on periodic jobs](https://mosquito-cr.github.io/manual/index.html#periodic-jobs) in the manual. ## Advanced usage For more advanced topics, including [use with Lucky Framework](https://mosquito-cr.github.io/manual/lucky_framework.html), [throttling or rate limiting](https://mosquito-cr.github.io/manual/rate_limiting.html), check out the [full manual](https://mosquito-cr.github.io/manual). ## Contributing Contributions are welcome. Please fork the repository, commit changes on a branch, and then open a pull request. ### Crystal Versions Mosquito aims to be compatible with the latest Crystal release, and the [latest patch for all post-1.0 minor crystal versions](https://github.com/mosquito-cr/mosquito/blob/master/.github/workflows/ci.yml#L17). For development purposes [you're encouraged to stay in sync with `.tool-versions`](https://github.com/mosquito-cr/mosquito/blob/master/.tool-versions). ### Testing This repository uses [minitest](https://github.com/ysbaddaden/minitest.cr) for testing. As a result, `crystal spec` doesn't do anything helpful. Do this instead: ``` make test ``` In lieu of `crystal spec` bells and whistles, Minitest provides a nice alternative to [running one test at a time instead of the whole suite](https://github.com/ysbaddaden/minitest.cr/pull/31).

def.name: job_for_type
def.body:
begin
  @@mapping[type]
rescue e : KeyError
  error = String.build do |s|
    s << "Could not find a job class for type \"#{type}\", perhaps you forgot to register it?\n\nCurrent known types are:\n"
    @@mapping.each do |k, v|
      s << "#{k}=>#{v}\n"
    end
    s << "\n\n"
  end
  raise(KeyError.new(error))
end

def.name: validate
def.body:
if @validated
  return
end
@validated = true
if redis_url.nil?
  message = "Mosquito cannot start because the redis connection string hasn't been provided.\n\nFor example, in your application config:\n\nMosquito.configure do |settings|\n  settings.redis_url = (ENV[\"REDIS_TLS_URL\"]? || ENV[\"REDIS_URL\"]? || \"redis://localhost:6379\")\nend\n\nSee Also: https://github.com/mosquito-cr/mosquito#connecting-to-redis"
  raise(message)
end

types.name: Job
types.doc:
A Job is a definition for work to be performed.
Jobs are pieces of code which run a JobRun.

- Jobs prevent double execution of a job for a job_run
- Jobs Rescue when a #perform method fails a job_run for any reason
- Jobs can be rescheduleable
types.summary: A Job is a definition for work to be performed.

def.name: queue
def.body:
if queue_name.blank?
  Queue.new("default")
else
  Queue.new(queue_name)
end

def.name: run
def.body:
begin
  begin
    before_hook
  rescue e : Exception
    Log.error(exception: e) do
      "Before hook raised, job will not be executed"
    end
    @state = State::Aborted
    return
  end
  @state = State::Running
  perform
  @state = State::Succeeded
rescue e
  Log.warn(exception: e) do
    "Job failed! Raised #{e.class}: #{e.message}"
  end
  @exception = e
  @state = State::Failed
ensure
  after_hook
end

def.name: after
before

types.name: JobRun
types.doc:
A JobRun is a unit of work which will be performed by a Job.
JobRuns know how to:
- store and retrieve their data to and from the datastore
- figure out what Job class they match to
- build an instance of that Job class and pass off the config data
- Ask the job to run

JobRun data is called `config` and is persisted in the backend under the key
`mosquito:job_run:job_run_id`.
types.summary: A JobRun is a unit of work which will be performed by a Job.

class_methods.name: config_key
class_methods.doc: The config key is the backend storage key for the metadata of this job_run.
class_methods.summary: The config key is the backend storage key for the metadata of this job_run.

class_methods.name: retrieve
class_methods.doc: Used to construct a job_run from the parameters stored in the backend.
class_methods.summary: Used to construct a job_run from the parameters stored in the backend.

def.name: retrieve
def.body:
fields = Mosquito.backend.retrieve(config_key(id))
if name = fields.delete("type")
else
  return
end
if timestamp = fields.delete("enqueue_time")
else
  return
end
retry_count = ((fields.delete("retry_count")) || 0).to_i
instance = new(name, Time.unix_ms(timestamp.to_i64), id, retry_count)
instance.config = fields
instance

constructors.name: new
constructors.args_string: (type : String, enqueue_time : Time = Time.utc, id : String | Nil = nil, retry_count : Int32 = 0)
constructors.args_html: (type : String, enqueue_time : Time = Time.utc, id : String | Nil = nil, retry_count : Int32 = 0)

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = allocate
_.initialize(type, enqueue_time, id, retry_count)
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end
_

instance_methods.doc: Returns `true` if this reference is the same as *other*. Invokes `same?`.

instance_methods.name: build_job
instance_methods.doc:
Builds a Job instance from this job_run. Populates the job with config from
the backend.
instance_methods.summary: Builds a Job instance from this job_run.

def.name: build_job
def.body:
if job = @job
  return job
end
@job = instance = (Base.job_for_type(type)).new
if instance.responds_to?(:vars_from)
  instance.vars_from(config)
end
instance.job_run_id = id
instance

def.name: run
def.body:
instance = build_job
instance.run
if executed? && failed?
  @retry_count = @retry_count + 1
  store
end

instance_methods.name: store
instance_methods.doc: Stores this job run configuration and metadata in the backend.

def.name: store
def.body:
fields = config.dup
fields["enqueue_time"] = enqueue_time.to_unix_ms.to_s
fields["type"] = type
fields["retry_count"] = retry_count.to_s
Mosquito.backend.store(config_key, fields)

instance_methods.name: to_s
instance_methods.doc:
Appends a short String representation of this object
which includes its class name and its object address.

```
class Person
  def initialize(@name : String, @age : Int32)
  end
end

Person.new("John", 32).to_s # => #<Person:0x10a199f20>
```
instance_methods.summary: Appends a short String representation of this object which includes its class name and its object address.

def.name: build
def.body:
id = [] of String
parts.each do |part|
  case part
  when Symbol
    id << (build(part.to_s))
  when String
    id << part
  when Array
    part.each do |e|
      id << (build(e))
    end
  when Tuple
    part.to_a.each do |e|
      id << (build(e))
    end
  when Number
    id << part.to_s
  else
    raise("#{part.class} is not a keyable type")
  end
end
id.flatten.join(KEY_SEPERATOR)

types.name: Metadata
types.doc:
Provides a real-time metadata store. Data is not cached, which allows
multiple workers to operate on the same structures in real time.

Each read or write incurs a round trip to the backend.

def.body:
if readonly?
  raise(RuntimeError.new("Cannot write to metadata, readonly=true"))
end
Mosquito.backend.set(root_key, key, value)

  raise(RuntimeError.new("Cannot write to metadata, readonly=true"))
end
Mosquito.backend.increment(root_key, key, by: -1)

def.name: increment
def.body:
if readonly?
  raise(RuntimeError.new("Cannot write to metadata, readonly=true"))
end
Mosquito.backend.increment(root_key, key, by: increment)

def.name: increment
def.body:
if readonly?
  raise(RuntimeError.new("Cannot write to metadata, readonly=true"))
end
Mosquito.backend.increment(root_key, key)

instance_methods.name: class
instance_methods.doc:
Returns the **runtime** `Class` of an object.

```
1.class       # => Int32
"hello".class # => String
```

Compare it with `typeof`, which returns the **compile-time** type of an object:

```
random_value = rand # => 0.627423
value = random_value < 0.5 ? 1 : "hello"
value         # => "hello"
value.class   # => String
typeof(value) # => Int32 | String
```
instance_methods.summary: Returns the runtime Class of an object.

def.name: try_to_execute
def.body:
now = Time.utc
if (last_executed_at + interval) <= now
  execute
  @last_executed_at = now
  true
else
  false
end

types.name: Queue
types.doc:
A named Queue.

Named Queues exist and have 4 ordered lists: waiting, pending, scheduled, and dead.

- The Waiting list is for jobs which need to be executed as soon as possible.
- The Pending list is for jobs which are currently being executed.
- The Scheduled list is indexed by execution time and holds jobs which need to be executed at a later time.
- The Dead list is for jobs which have been retried too many times and are no longer viable.

A job_run is represented in a queue by its id.

A job_run flows through the queues in this manner:


```text
 Time=0: JobRun does not exist yet, lists are empty

   Waiting  Pending  Scheduled    Dead

 ---------------------------------
 Time=1: JobRun is enqueued

   Waiting  Pending  Scheduled    Dead
    JobRun#1

 ---------------------------------
 Time=2: JobRun begins. JobRun is moved to pending and executed

   Waiting  Pending  Scheduled    Dead
             JobRun#1

 ---------------------------------
 Time=3: JobRuns are Enqueued.

   Waiting  Pending  Scheduled    Dead
    JobRun#2   JobRun#1
    JobRun#3

 ---------------------------------
 Time=4: JobRun succeeds, next job_run begins.

   Waiting  Pending  Scheduled    Dead
    JobRun#3   JobRun#2

 ---------------------------------
 Time=5: JobRun fails and is scheduled for later, next job_run begins.

   Waiting  Pending  Scheduled     Dead
             JobRun#3  t=7:JobRun#2

 ---------------------------------
 Time=6: JobRun succeeds. Nothing is executing.

   Waiting  Pending  Scheduled     Dead
                     t=7:JobRun#2

 ---------------------------------
 Time=7: Scheduled job_run is due and is moved to waiting. Nothing is executing.

   Waiting  Pending  Scheduled     Dead
    JobRun#2

 ---------------------------------
 Time=8: JobRun begins executing (for the second time).

   Waiting  Pending  Scheduled     Dead
             JobRun#2

 ---------------------------------
 Time=9: JobRun finished successfully. No more job_runs present.

   Waiting  Pending  Scheduled     Dead

```

def.body:
if empty?
  return
end
if job_run = backend.dequeue
  job_run
else

  nil
end

instance_methods.name: length
instance_methods.summary: DEPRECATED see #size

def.name: enqueue
def.body:
build_job_run.tap do |job_run|
  job_run.store
  self.class.queue.enqueue(job_run, in: delay_interval)
end

def.name: enqueue
def.body:
build_job_run.tap do |job_run|
  job_run.store
  self.class.queue.enqueue(job_run, at: execute_time)
end

Should this job be cancelled?
If not, update the rate limit metadata.
instance_methods.summary: Should this job be cancelled? If not, update the rate limit metadata.

def.name: rate_limited?
def.body:
if @@rate_limit_ceiling < 0
  return false
end
if maxed_rate_for_window?
  return true
end
false

instance_methods.name: reschedule_interval
instance_methods.doc:
Configure the reschedule interval so that the job_run is not run again until it
should be allowed through the rate limiter.
instance_methods.summary: Configure the reschedule interval so that the job_run is not run again until it should be allowed through the rate limiter.

def.name: reschedule_interval
def.body:
if rate_limited? && (window_expiration = window_expires_at)
  next_window = window_expiration - Time.utc
  log("Rate limited: will run again in #{next_window}")
  next_window
else
  super(retry_count)
end

instance_methods.name: rescheduleable?
instance_methods.doc: Configure the rescheduler to always retry if a job is rate limited.
instance_methods.summary: Configure the rescheduler to always retry if a job is rate limited.

def.name: rescheduleable?
def.body:
if rate_limited?
  true
else
  super(retry_count)
end

instance_methods.name: update_window_start
instance_methods.doc: Resets the run count and logs the start of window.
instance_methods.summary: Resets the run count and logs the start of window.

def.name: update_window_start
def.body:
started_window = window_start || Time::UNIX_EPOCH
now = Time.utc
if (now - started_window) > @@rate_limit_interval
  metadata["window_start"] = now.to_unix.to_s
  metadata["run_count"] = "0"
end

instance_methods.name: window_expires_at
instance_methods.doc:
When does the current rate limit window expire?
Returns nil if the window is already expired.
instance_methods.summary: When does the current rate limit window expire? Returns nil if the window is already expired.

def.name: window_expires_at
def.body:
if started_window = window_start
else
  return nil
end
expiration_time = started_window + @@rate_limit_interval
if expiration_time < Time.utc
  nil
else
  expiration_time
end

instance_methods.doc: Calculates the start of the rate limit window.
instance_methods.summary: Calculates the start of the rate limit window.

instance_methods.name: metadata
instance_methods.doc:
Provides an instance of the metadata store used to track rate limit
stats.
instance_methods.summary: Provides an instance of the metadata store used to track rate limit stats.

instance_methods.name: rate_limit_key
instance_methods.doc: Resolves the key used to index the metadata store for this test.
instance_methods.summary: Resolves the key used to index the metadata store for this test.

instance_methods.name: rate_limit_stats
instance_methods.doc:
Statistics about the rate limiter, including both the configuration
parameters and the run counts.
instance_methods.summary: Statistics about the rate limiter, including both the configuration parameters and the run counts.

def.name: rate_limit_stats
def.body:
meta = metadata
window_start = if window_start_ = meta["window_start"]?
  Time.unix(window_start_.to_i)
else
  Time::UNIX_EPOCH
end
run_count = if run_count_ = meta["run_count"]?
  run_count_.to_i
else
  0
end
{interval: @@rate_limit_interval, key: @@rate_limit_key, increment: @@rate_limit_increment, limit: @@rate_limit_ceiling, window_start: window_start, run_count: run_count}

instance_methods.name: throttle
instance_methods.doc:
Configures rate limiting for this job.

`limit` and `per` are used to control the run count and the window
duration. Defaults to a limit of 1 run per second.

`increment` is used to indicate how many "hits" against a single job is
worth. Defaults to 1.

`key` is used to combine rate limiting functions across multiple jobs.
instance_methods.summary: Configures rate limiting for this job.
instance_methods.args_string: (*, limit : Int32 = 1, per : Time::Span = 1.second, increment = 1, key = self.name.underscore)
instance_methods.args_html: (*, limit : Int32 = 1, per : Time::Span = 1.second, increment = 1, key = self.name.underscore)

  redis.expire(key, ttl)
else
  redis.del(key)
end

def.name: list_queues
def.body:
search_queue_prefixes = QUEUES.first(2)
search_queue_prefixes.map do |search_queue|
  key = build_key(search_queue, "*")
  long_names = redis.keys(key)
  queue_prefix = (build_key(search_queue)) + ":"
  long_names.map(&.to_s).map do |long_name|
    long_name.sub(queue_prefix, "")
  end
end.flatten.uniq

class_methods.name: lock?
class_methods.args_string: (key : String, value : String, ttl : Time::Span) : Bool
class_methods.args_html: (key : String, value : String, ttl : Time::Span) : Bool

def.name: lock?
def.body:
response = redis.set(key, value, ex: ttl.to_i, nx: true)
response == "OK"

def.name: redis
def.body:
load_scripts = @@connection.nil?
connection = @@connection || (@@connection = ::Redis::Client.new(URI.parse(Mosquito.configuration.redis_url.to_s)))
if load_scripts
  Scripts.load(connection)
end
connection

class_methods.name: remove_matching_key
class_methods.args_string: (*, keys = [] of String, args = [] of String, loadscripts = true)
class_methods.args_html: (*, keys = [] of String, args = [] of String, loadscripts = true)

def.name: remove_matching_key
def.body:
begin
  script = "  if redis.call(\"get\",KEYS[1]) == ARGV[1] then\n      return redis.call(\"del\",KEYS[1])\n  else\n      return 0\n  end"
  digest = Scripts.remove_matching_key
  redis.evalsha(digest, keys: keys, args: args)
rescue exception : Redis::Error
  if exception.message.try(&.starts_with?("NOSCRIPT"))
  else
    raise(exception)
  end
  if loadscripts
  else
    raise(exception)
  end
  (Log.for("remove_matching_key")).warn do
    "Redis Scripts have gone missing, reloading"
  end
  Scripts.load(redis)
  remove_matching_key(keys: keys, args: args, loadscripts: false)
end

class_methods.name: set
class_methods.args_string: (key : String, field : String, value : String) : String
class_methods.args_html: (key : String, field : String, value : String) : String

def.name: dequeue
deschedule
def.body:
time = Time.utc
overdue_job_runs = (redis.zrangebyscore(scheduled_q, "0", time.to_unix_ms.to_s)).as(Array)
if overdue_job_runs.any?
else
  return [] of JobRun
end
overdue_job_runs.compact_map do |job_run_id|
  redis.zrem(scheduled_q, job_run_id.to_s)
  JobRun.retrieve(job_run_id.as(String))
end

def.name: dump_dead_q
def.body:
key = dead_q
type = redis.type(key)
if type == "list"
  ((redis.lrange(key, "0", "-1")).as(Array(Redis::Value))).map() do |__arg6|
    __arg6.as(String)
  end
else
  if type == "zset"
    ((redis.zrange(key, 0, -1)).as(Array(Redis::Value))).map() do |__arg7|
      __arg7.as(String)
    end
  else
    if type == "none"
      [] of String
    else
      raise("don't know how to dump a #{type} for dead")
    end
  end
end

instance_methods.name: enqueue
instance_methods.doc: from queue.cr
instance_methods.summary: from queue.cr

def.name: size
def.body:
queues = [waiting_q, pending_q]
if include_dead
  queues << dead_q
end
queue_size = queues.map do |key|
  (redis.llen(key)).as(Int64)
end.reduce do |sum, i|
  sum + i
end
scheduled_size = redis.zcount(scheduled_q, "0", "+inf")
queue_size + (scheduled_size.as(Int64))

def.name: start
def.body:
Log.notice do
  "Mosquito is buzzing..."
end
instance.run

def.name: stop
def.body:
Log.notice do
  "Mosquito is shutting down..."
end
self.keep_running = false
instance.stop

def.name: enqueue_delayed_jobs
def.body:
run_at_most(every: 1.second, label: :enqueue_delayed_job_runs) do |t|
  queue_list.each do |q|
    overdue_jobs = q.dequeue_scheduled
    if overdue_jobs.any?
    else
      next
    end
    (Log.for("enqueue_delayed_jobs")).info do
      "#{overdue_jobs.size} delayed jobs ready in #{q.name}"
    end
    overdue_jobs.each do |job_run|
      q.enqueue(job_run)
    end
  end
end

def.name: enqueue_periodic_jobs
def.body:
run_at_most(every: 1.second, label: :enqueue_periodic_job_runs) do |now|
  Base.scheduled_job_runs.each do |scheduled_job_run|
    enqueued = scheduled_job_run.try_to_execute
    (Log.for("enqueue_periodic_jobs")).debug do
      if enqueued
        "enqueued #{scheduled_job_run.class}"
      end
    end
  end
end

def.name: only_if_coordinator
def.body:
duration = 0.seconds
if Mosquito.configuration.run_cron_scheduler
  yield
  if @emitted_scheduling_deprecation_runtime_message
  else
    Log.warn do
      "Scheduling coordinator / CRON Scheduler has been manually activated. This behavior is deprecated in favor of distributed locking and the default will change in 1.1.0. See https://github.com/mosquito-cr/mosquito/pull/108 "
    end
    @emitted_scheduling_deprecation_runtime_message = true
  end
  return
end
if Mosquito.configuration.use_distributed_lock
else
  return
end
if Mosquito.backend.lock?(lock_key, instance_id, LockTTL)
  duration = Time.measure do
    yield
  end
  Mosquito.backend.unlock(lock_key, instance_id)
end
if duration > LockTTL
else
  return
end
Log.warn do
  "Coordination activities took longer than LockTTL (#{duration} > #{LockTTL}) "
end

types.name: Executor
types.doc:
An Executor is responsible for building Job classes with deserialized
parameters and calling #run on them. It measures the time it takes to
run a job and provides detailed log messages about the current status.

Executor#deqeue_and_run_jobs is the entrypoint and shoud be treated as
if it will return only after a relative eternity.
types.summary: An Executor is responsible for building Job classes with deserialized parameters and calling #run on them.

instance_methods.name: failed_job_ttl
instance_methods.doc: How long a job config is persisted after failure
instance_methods.summary: How long a job config is persisted after failure

instance_methods.name: failed_job_ttl=
instance_methods.doc: How long a job config is persisted after failure
instance_methods.summary: How long a job config is persisted after failure

def.name: run_next_job
def.body:
job_run = q.dequeue
if job_run
else
  return
end
Log.notice do
  "#{"Starting:".colorize.magenta} #{job_run} from #{q.name}"
end
duration = Time.measure do
  job_run.run
end.total_seconds
if job_run.succeeded?
  Log.notice do
    "#{"Success:".colorize.green} #{job_run} finished and took #{time_with_units(duration)}"
  end
  q.forget(job_run)
  job_run.delete(in: successful_job_ttl)
else
  message = String::Builder.new
  message << "Failure: ".colorize.red
  message << job_run
  message << " failed, taking "
  message << (time_with_units(duration))
  message << " and "
  if job_run.rescheduleable?
    next_execution = Time.utc + job_run.reschedule_interval
    q.reschedule(job_run, next_execution)
    message << "will run again".colorize.cyan
    message << " in "
    message << job_run.reschedule_interval
    message << " (at "
    message << next_execution
    message << ")"
  else
    q.banish(job_run)
    job_run.delete(in: failed_job_ttl)
    message << "cannot be rescheduled".colorize.yellow
  end
  Log.warn do
    message.to_s
  end
end

instance_methods.name: successful_job_ttl
instance_methods.doc: How long a job config is persisted after success
instance_methods.summary: How long a job config is persisted after success

instance_methods.name: successful_job_ttl=
instance_methods.doc: How long a job config is persisted after success
instance_methods.summary: How long a job config is persisted after success

def.name: time_with_units
def.body:
if seconds > 0.1
  "#{((seconds) * 100).trunc / 100}s".colorize.red
else
  if seconds > 0.001
    "#{(seconds * 1000).trunc}ms".colorize.yellow
  else
    if seconds > 0.000001
      "#{(seconds * 100000).trunc}s".colorize.green
    else
      if seconds > 0.000000001
        "#{(seconds * 1000000000).trunc}ns".colorize.green
      else
        "no discernible time at all".colorize.green
      end
    end
  end
end

types.name: Overseer
types.doc:
The Overseer is responsible for managing:
- a `Coordinator`
- an `Executor`
- the `QueueList`
- any idle state as configured

An overseer manages the loop that each thread or process runs.
types.summary: The Overseer is responsible for managing: - a Coordinator - an Executor - the QueueList - any idle state as configured

instance_methods.name: idle_wait
instance_methods.doc: Minimum time in seconds to wait between checking for jobs.
instance_methods.summary: Minimum time in seconds to wait between checking for jobs.

instance_methods.name: idle_wait=
instance_methods.doc: Minimum time in seconds to wait between checking for jobs.
instance_methods.summary: Minimum time in seconds to wait between checking for jobs.

instance_methods.name: run
instance_methods.doc:
Runs the overseer workflow.
Infinite loop.
instance_methods.summary: Runs the overseer workflow.

def.name: run
def.body:
Log.info do
  worker_id + " clocking in."
end
while keep_running
  tick
end
Log.info do
  worker_id + " finished for now."
end

def.name: stop
def.body:
Log.info do
  worker_id + " is done after this job."
end
@keep_running = false

def.name: tick
def.body:
delta = Time.measure do
  queue_list.fetch
  coordinator.bloop
  executor.dequeue_and_run_jobs
end
if delta < idle_wait
  sleep(idle_wait - delta)
end

types.name: QueueList
types.doc: QueueList handles searching the redis keyspace for named queues.
types.summary: QueueList handles searching the redis keyspace for named queues.

def.name: fetch
def.body:
run_at_most(every: 0.25.seconds, label: :fetch_queues) do |t|
  candidate_queues = Mosquito.backend.list_queues.map do |name|
    Queue.new(name)
  end
  @queues = filter_queues(candidate_queues)
  (Log.for("fetch_queues")).debug do
    if @queues.size > 0
      "found #{@queues.size} queues: #{@queues.map(&.name).join(", ")}"
    end
  end
end

instance_methods.doc:
abstract, override if desired.

True if this job is rescheduleable, false if not.
instance_methods.summary: abstract, override if desired.

constants.name: SCRIPTS

def.name: load
def.body:
SCRIPTS.each do |name, script|
  sha = @@script_sha[name] = connection.script_load(script)
  Log.info do
    "loading script : #{name} => #{sha}"
  end
end

def.name: serialize_symbol
def.body: raise("Symbols cannot be deserialized. Stringify your symbol first to pass it as a mosquito job parameter.")
